intro: Hallieracantha peranthera, commonly known as the mountain sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with hairy stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white. Its leaves are narrow and succulent, adapted to the arid and cold conditions of its habitat. Hallieracantha peranthera plays a role in stabilizing soil in rocky and mountainous regions.
